title: Account banned for no direct reason?
body:
Hey,

I received this email on the 16th of June.

"Hello Summoner,

Your account: speedybus was banned due to the use of malicious 3rd party programs or modifications to your League of Legends client. We believe that all players should play on equal footing in an effort to promote competitive sportsmanship. You should be aware that modifying your League of Legends client is against the Terms of Use: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse. We hope you can see that it is unsatisfying to play against other players who are using a tool to gain an advantage over others.

If you wish to dispute the actions taken against your account, you may contact us via this link: http://support.riotgames.com"

I have contacted the support which the majority of it was automatic messages, I want to apologise for being rude but I hope you understand as I have had that account for years and spent a lot of money on it. I haven't used third party programs or modified anything. I built my computer earlier this year and the only thing I downloaded for league is the client itself on the League of Legends website. Along with a few voice chat programs like skype, teamspeak3 and curse voice (Haven't actually used curse voice yet so far)

I want to know why i got permanently suspended specifically. If it's actually legitimately something that I've unknowingly done I can accept that. But I swear I've done nothing wrong. 150% sure. No-one has played on my account (boosting), I shun people who do, I don't use anything to gain an edge over other players. Just the game itself in its purity.

I don't care about the process made to get to whatever thing your detection stuff has found, I just want to know what you've found. Maybe it's something to do with Windows 10 or something like that, I don't know unless you cooperate.

I've played league for years and spent plenty of money on it, if I was going to be banned, why didn't it happen years ago? Nothing has changed.

I hope that riot can look into this again as I truly believe there has been a mistake.

I haven't really played LoL in the last 3 months. I played a couple of games one being an Ahri ranked game if I remember correctly during that three months but that's it.

(Accidentally posted this on the NA side)

Cheers,

SpeedyBus

Hey man,

So right off the bat; unfortunately you'll never be able to find out exactly why you were suspended. 

It's **Riot**'s policy to not share this information because it can help hackers/scripters to get around the system next time. I know you're not a scripter, but **Riot** doesn't know that, and that's why they have to take these precautions.

**That doesn't mean we can't help though.** I'd hate to see Riot punish a player unfairly, so I'm more than willing to get to the bottom of this issue for you.

_**Here's what we'll need first:**_

1. You said you already contacted **Riot** support. We'll need a you to provide the Support Ticket ID so we can look into what happened. You can find that [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests).

2. Absolutely anything that might have happened on your account. It would be great if we could identify why **Riot** received a false positive on this.

 _We're looking for:_ Any programs that modify the client (language packs, skin mods), have you logged in on someone else's computer?... etc.

3. Anything else you want to mention that might help, such as evidence or expanding on anything you missed out in the original post.

Just reply to this post with that information, and I'll do everything in my power to sort this out for you :)

> _**Just for next time:**_

> We're not really supposed to handle player support issues, but since you're having trouble with them, I'll make an exception.

> In the future though, try to keep pressing Player Support for answers a bit longer. We usually just end up inquiring with our contacts at Riot Player Support anyway, so it's really not much different.

Can you please help me out in asking them for an unban request/ trial on my account. Never committed an offence since i started playing and everyone regardless who it is deserves a second chance. Mine is also unjustified please help me and Speedy Bus out.

Kind regards.

Your case is honestly so unfortunate and I feel really bad for you :(

Sadly, scripting is a perma-ban no questions asked, even if it wasn't you. I'm sure a lot of the **Rioters** you talked to would have unbanned your account if they could, but they can't go against the rules and put their job/career at risk.

You're in a tight spot ATM and it's going to take a small miracle to get you out. There might be hope still though... Maybe.

__*

Usually the "top dogs" over at player support are able to reverse bans on their own, without consulting anyone. In the past **Lyte** would do this in very special cases, and usually only for behavioral permabans.

Your's might be a special case, but it's not a behavioral ban. Either way, we're at the end of the line here, so it's best we give it a shot anyway.

_**Here's what I'd advise you to do:**_

+ **Lyte** left the company recently, but there's still a few people like him around, such as [**Riot Tantram**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/player/NA/Riot%20Tantram) over on NA.

 The [NA boards](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/) is your best shot at finding one of these people.

+ Tell them your story over on the NA boards. Make sure you put **@Riot** in the post title to increase the chances of someone seeing it.

 Publish your post at around 1 - 2 pm (California time) because that's most **Rioters** are online. Also make sure to put it in Player Behaviour section as the right people are more likely to see it there as well.

If that doesn't work then I'm not sure anything can be done. The best thing you can do is learn from this experience and move on. Don't let something as trivial as a league account weigh you down. There's plenty of other awesome games out there even if you don't want to make a new LoL account.

I wish you the best of luck man :)

Thank you so much for your help! It actually means something having someone actually listen and understand where I'm coming from. I will definitely give the NA forums a go!

As much as I don't play League much at all anymore I'd still like to know I'd be able to play it if I wanted to but at this point I'm content about not getting my account back because you've actually tried to help me :)

Thankyou! :)
